info.title: Gemini API
info.description: The Gemini Interactions API is an experimental API that allows developers to build generative AI applications using Gemini models. Gemini is our most capable model, built from the ground up to be multimodal. It can generalize and seamlessly understand, operate across, and combine different types of information including language, images, audio, video, and code. You can use the Gemini API for use cases like reasoning across text and images, content generation, dialogue agents, summarization and classification systems, and more.

outputs.text:
Hello! I'm functioning perfectly and ready to assist you.

How are you doing today?
The capital of France is Paris.
A white humanoid robot with glowing blue eyes stands holding a red skateboard.
Here is a comprehensive research report on the current state of cancer research...

x-codeSamples.label: simple
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/interactions \
  -H "x-goog-api-key: $GEMINI_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "model": "gemini-2.5-flash",
    "input": "Hello, how are you?"
  }'

x-codeSamples.label: simple
x-codeSamples.source:
from google import genai

client = genai.Client()
interaction = client.interactions.create(
    model="gemini-2.5-flash",
    input="Hello, how are you?",
)
print(interaction.outputs[-1].text)

x-codeSamples.label: simple
multi_turn
multi_turn
x-codeSamples.source:
from google import genai

client = genai.Client()
response = client.interactions.create(
    model="gemini-2.5-flash",
    input=[
        { "role": "user", "content": "Hello!" },
        { "role": "model", "content": "Hi there! How can I help you today?" },
        { "role": "user", "content": "What is the capital of France?" }
    ]
)
print(response.outputs[-1].text)

x-codeSamples.label: multi_turn
multimodal_image
multimodal_image
multimodal_image
function_calling
function_calling
function_calling
deep_research
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/interactions \
  -H "x-goog-api-key: $GEMINI_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "agent": "deep-research-pro-preview-12-2025",
    "input": "Find a cure to cancer",
    "background": true
  }'

x-codeSamples.label: deep_research
x-codeSamples.source:
from google import genai

client = genai.Client()
interaction = client.interactions.create(
    agent="deep-research-pro-preview-12-2025",
    input="find a cure to cancer",
    background=True,
)
print(interaction.status)

x-codeSamples.label: deep_research

get.description: Retrieves the full details of a single interaction based on its `Interaction.id`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the interaction to retrieve.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: If set to true, the generated content will be streamed incrementally.

parameters.name: last_event_id
parameters.description: Optional. If set, resumes the interaction stream from the next chunk after the event marked by the event id. Can only be used if `stream` is true.

outputs.text: I'm doing great, thank you for asking! How can I help you today?

x-codeSamples.label: get
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/interactions/v1_ChdPU0F4YWFtNkFwS2kxZThQZ05lbXdROBIXT1NBeGFhbTZBcEtpMWU4UGdOZW13UTg \
  -H "x-goog-api-key: $GEMINI_API_KEY"

x-codeSamples.label: get
x-codeSamples.source:
from google import genai

client = genai.Client()

interaction = client.interactions.get(id="v1_ChdPU0F4YWFtNkFwS2kxZThQZ05lbXdROBIXT1NBeGFhbTZBcEtpMWU4UGdOZW13UTg")
print(interaction.status)

x-codeSamples.label: get

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the interaction to delete.

x-codeSamples.label: delete

curl -X DELETE https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/interactions/v1_ChdPU0F4YWFtNkFwS2kxZThQZ05lbXdROBIXT1NBeGFhbTZBcEtpMWU4UGdOZW13UTg \

from google import genai

client = genai.Client()

interaction = client.interactions.delete(id="v1_ChdPU0F4YWFtNkFwS2kxZThQZ05lbXdROBIXT1NBeGFhbTZBcEtpMWU4UGdOZW13UTg")

post.description: Cancels an interaction by id. This only applies to background interactions that are still running.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the interaction to cancel.

x-codeSamples.label: cancel
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/interactions/v1_ChdPU0F4YWFtNkFwS2kxZThQZ05lbXdROBIXT1NBeGFhbTZBcEtpMWU4UGdOZW13UTg/cancel \
  -H "x-goog-api-key: $GEMINI_API_KEY"

x-codeSamples.label: cancel
x-codeSamples.source:
from google import genai

client = genai.Client()

interaction = client.interactions.cancel(id="v1_ChdPU0F4YWFtNkFwS2kxZThQZ05lbXdROBIXT1NBeGFhbTZBcEtpMWU4UGdOZW13UTg")
print(interaction.status)

x-codeSamples.label: cancel

api_version.name: api_version
api_version.description: Which version of the API to use.

start_index.description:
Start of segment of the response that is attributed to this source.

Index indicates the start of the segment, measured in bytes.

end_index.description: End of the attributed segment, exclusive.

source.description:
Source attributed for a portion of the text. Could be a URL, title, or
other identifier.

signature.description: Signature to match the backend source to be part of the generation.

summary.text: The user is asking about the weather. I should use the get_weather tool.

FunctionCallContent.description: A function tool call content block.

name.description: The name of the tool to call.

arguments.description: The arguments to pass to the function.

id.description: A unique ID for this specific tool call.

arguments.description: The arguments to pass to the code execution.

id.description: A unique ID for this specific tool call.

CodeExecutionCallArguments.description: The arguments to pass to the code execution.

x-google-enum-descriptions: Python >= 3.10, with numpy and simpy available.

arguments.description: The arguments to pass to the URL context.

id.description: A unique ID for this specific tool call.

UrlContextCallArguments.description: The arguments to pass to the URL context.

name.description: The name of the tool which was called.

server_name.description: The name of the used MCP server.

arguments.description: The JSON object of arguments for the function.

id.description: A unique ID for this specific tool call.

arguments.description: The arguments to pass to Google Search.

id.description: A unique ID for this specific tool call.

GoogleSearchCallArguments.description: The arguments to pass to Google Search.

queries.description: Web search queries for the following-up web search.

FunctionResultContent.description: A function tool result content block.

name.description: The name of the tool that was called.

is_error.description: Whether the tool call resulted in an error.

result.description: The result of the tool call.

call_id.description: ID to match the ID from the function call block.

result.description: The output of the code execution.

is_error.description: Whether the code execution resulted in an error.

signature.description: A signature hash for backend validation.

call_id.description: ID to match the ID from the code execution call block.

signature.description: The signature of the URL context result.

result.description: The results of the URL context.

is_error.description: Whether the URL context resulted in an error.

call_id.description: ID to match the ID from the url context call block.

UrlContextResult.description: The result of the URL context.

status.description: The status of the URL retrieval.
x-google-enum-descriptions: Url retrieval is failed due to error.
Url retrieval is failed because the content is behind paywall.
Url retrieval is failed because the content is unsafe.

signature.description: The signature of the Google Search result.

result.description: The results of the Google Search.

is_error.description: Whether the Google Search resulted in an error.

call_id.description: ID to match the ID from the google search call block.

GoogleSearchResult.description: The result of the Google Search.

url.description: URI reference of the search result.

rendered_content.description: Web content snippet that can be embedded in a web page or an app webview.

name.description: Name of the tool which is called for this specific tool call.

server_name.description: The name of the used MCP server.

result.description: The result of the tool call.

call_id.description: ID to match the ID from the MCP server tool call block.

result.description: The results of the File Search.

FileSearchResult.description: The result of the File Search.

title.description: The title of the search result.

text.description: The text of the search result.

file_search_store.description: The name of the file search store.

role.description:
The originator of this turn. Must be user for input or model for
model output.

temperature.description: Controls the randomness of the output.

top_p.description: The maximum cumulative probability of tokens to consider when sampling.

seed.description: Seed used in decoding for reproducibility.

stop_sequences.description: A list of character sequences that will stop output interaction.

tool_choice.description: The tool choice for the interaction.

thinking_level.description: The level of thought tokens that the model should generate.

thinking_summaries.description: Whether to include thought summaries in the response.

max_output_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to include in the response.

mode.description: The mode of the tool choice.

tools.description: The names of the allowed tools.

speaker.description: The speaker's name, it should match the speaker name given in the prompt.

additionalProperties.description: Additional properties for the dynamic agent.

DeepResearchAgentConfig.description: Configuration for the Deep Research agent.

thinking_summaries.description: Whether to include thought summaries in the response.

Function.description: A tool that can be used by the model.

parameters.description: The JSON Schema for the function's parameters.

x-codeSamples.label: function_calling
function_calling
function_calling

CodeExecution.description: A tool that can be used by the model to execute code.

x-codeSamples.label: code_execution
code_execution
x-codeSamples.source:
from google import genai

client = genai.Client()
response = client.interactions.create(
    model="gemini-2.5-flash",
    tools=[{"type": "code_execution"}],
    input="Calculate the first 10 Fibonacci numbers"
)
print(response.outputs[0])

x-codeSamples.label: code_execution

UrlContext.description: A tool that can be used by the model to fetch URL context.

x-codeSamples.label: url_context
url_context
x-codeSamples.source:
from google import genai

client = genai.Client()
response = client.interactions.create(
    model="gemini-2.5-flash",
    tools=[{"type": "url_context"}],
    input="Summarize https://www.example.com"
)
print(response.outputs[0])

x-codeSamples.label: url_context

ComputerUse.description: A tool that can be used by the model to interact with the computer.

excludedPredefinedFunctions.description: The list of predefined functions that are excluded from the model call.

x-codeSamples.label: computer_use
computer_use
x-codeSamples.source:
from google import genai

client = genai.Client()
response = client.interactions.create(
    model="gemini-2.5-computer-use-preview-10-2025",
    tools=[{"type": "computer_use"}],
    input="Find a flight to Tokyo"
)
print(response.outputs[0])

x-codeSamples.label: computer_use

McpServer.description: A MCPServer is a server that can be called by the model to perform actions.

url.description:
The full URL for the MCPServer endpoint.
Example: "https://api.example.com/mcp"

headers.description: Optional: Fields for authentication headers, timeouts, etc., if needed.

x-codeSamples.label: mcp_server
mcp_server
x-codeSamples.source:
from google import genai

client = genai.Client()
response = client.interactions.create(
    model="gemini-2.5-flash",
    tools=[{
        "type": "mcp_server",
        "name": "weather_service",
        "url": "https://gemini-api-demos.uc.r.appspot.com/mcp"
    }],
    input="Today is 12-05-2025, what is the temperature today in London?"
)
print(response.outputs[0])

x-codeSamples.label: mcp_server

GoogleSearch.description: A tool that can be used by the model to search Google.

x-codeSamples.label: google_search
google_search
x-codeSamples.source:
from google import genai

client = genai.Client()
response = client.interactions.create(
    model="gemini-2.5-flash",
    tools=[{"type": "google_search"}],
    input="Who is the current president of France?"
)
print(response.outputs[0])

x-codeSamples.label: google_search

FileSearch.description: A tool that can be used by the model to search files.

file_search_store_names.description: The file search store names to search.

top_k.description: The number of semantic retrieval chunks to retrieve.

metadata_filter.description: Metadata filter to apply to the semantic retrieval documents and chunks.

x-codeSamples.label: file_search
file_search
x-codeSamples.source:
from google import genai

client = genai.Client()
response = client.interactions.create(
    model="gemini-2.5-flash",
    tools=[{
        "type": "file_search",
        "file_search_store_names": ["fileSearchStores/m64d1sevsr4y-xfyawui3fxqg"]
    }],
    input="Who is the author of the book?"
)
print(response.outputs[0])

x-codeSamples.label: file_search

Usage.description: Statistics on the interaction request's token usage.

total_input_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the prompt (context).

input_tokens_by_modality.description: A breakdown of input token usage by modality.

total_cached_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the cached part of the prompt (the cached content).

cached_tokens_by_modality.description: A breakdown of cached token usage by modality.

total_output_tokens.description: Total number of tokens across all the generated responses.

output_tokens_by_modality.description: A breakdown of output token usage by modality.

total_tool_use_tokens.description: Number of tokens present in tool-use prompt(s).

tool_use_tokens_by_modality.description: A breakdown of tool-use token usage by modality.

total_reasoning_tokens.description: Number of tokens of thoughts for thinking models.

total_tokens.description:
Total token count for the interaction request (prompt + responses + other
internal tokens).

ModalityTokens.description: The token count for a single response modality.

modality.description: The modality associated with the token count.

tokens.description: Number of tokens for the modality.

event_id.description:
The event_id token to be used to resume the interaction stream, from
this event.

outputs.text: Elaras life was a symphony of quiet moments. A librarian, she found solace in the hushed aisles, the scent of aged paper, and the predictable rhythm of her days. Her small apartment, meticulously ordered, reflected this internal calm, save

for one beloved anomaly: a chipped porcelain teacup, inherited from her grandmother, which held her morning Earl Grey.

One Tuesday, stirring her tea, Elara paused. At the bottom, nestled against the porcelain, was a star.

Not a star-shaped tea leaf, but a miniature, perfectly formed celestial body, radiating a faint, cool luminescence. Before she could gasp, it dissolved, leaving only the amber swirl of her brew. She dismissed it as a trick of

tired eyes.

But the next morning, a gossamer-thin feather, smaller than an eyelash and shimmering with iridescent hues, floated on the surface. It vanished the moment she tried to touch it. A week later, a single,

impossibly delicate bloom, like spun moonbeam, unfolded in her cup before fading into nothingness.

These weren't illusions. Each day, Elaras chipped teacup offered a fleeting, exquisite secret. A tiny, perfect

crystal, a miniature spiral nebula, a fragment of rainbow caught in liquid form. They never lingered, never accumulated, simply *were* and then *weren't*, leaving behind a residue of quiet wonder.

Elara never spoke

of it. It was her private wellspring, a daily reminder that magic could exist in the smallest, most overlooked corners of the world. Her routine remained unchanged, her external life a picture of calm, but inside, a secret garden blo
omed. Each dawn brought not just tea, but the silent promise of extraordinary beauty, waiting patiently in a chipped teacup.

this event.

this event.

error.message: Failed to get completed interaction: Result not found.

code.description: A URI that identifies the error type.

x-google-enum-descriptions: Indicates the model should return text.
Indicates the model should return images.
Indicates the model should return audio.

model.description: The name of the `Model` used for generating the interaction.

agent.description: The name of the `Agent` used for generating the interaction.

id.description: Output only. A unique identifier for the interaction completion.

status.description: Output only. The status of the interaction.

created.description:
Output only. The time at which the response was created in ISO 8601 format
(YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ).

updated.description:
Output only. The time at which the response was last updated in ISO 8601 format
(YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ).

role.description: Output only. The role of the interaction.

outputs.description: Output only. Responses from the model.

tools.description: A list of tool declarations the model may call during interaction.

background.description: Whether to run the model interaction in the background.

object.description: Output only. The object type of the interaction. Always set to `interaction`.

usage.description: Output only. Statistics on the interaction request's token usage.

response_modalities.description: The requested modalities of the response (TEXT, IMAGE, AUDIO).

response_format.description:
Enforces that the generated response is a JSON object that complies with
the JSON schema specified in this field.

response_mime_type.description: The mime type of the response. This is required if response_format is set.

previous_interaction_id.description: The ID of the previous interaction, if any.

generation_config.description: Input only. Configuration parameters for the model interaction.

ModelOption.title: Model
ModelOption.description: The model that will complete your prompt.\n\nSee [models](https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/models) for additional details.

anyOf.description: Our state-of-the-art multipurpose model, which excels at coding and complex reasoning tasks.
Our first hybrid reasoning model which supports a 1M token context window and has thinking budgets.
The latest model based on the 2.5 Flash model. 2.5 Flash Preview is best for large scale processing, low-latency, high volume tasks that require thinking, and agentic use cases.
Our smallest and most cost effective model, built for at scale usage.
The latest model based on Gemini 2.5 Flash lite optimized for cost-efficiency, high throughput and high quality.
Our native audio models optimized for higher quality audio outputs with better pacing, voice naturalness, verbosity, and mood.
Our native image generation model, optimized for speed, flexibility, and contextual understanding. Text input and output is priced the same as 2.5 Flash.
Our 2.5 Pro text-to-speech audio model optimized for powerful, low-latency speech generation for more natural outputs and easier to steer prompts.
Our most intelligent model with SOTA reasoning and multimodal understanding, and powerful agentic and vibe coding capabilities.
Our most intelligent model built for speed, combining frontier intelligence with superior search and grounding.
